title: All the Tour de France team bikes, tech and kit 2024
content:
Cyclist
All the Tour de France team bikes, tech and kit 2024

Despite Jumbo-Visma’s Grand Tour dominance, Specialized was the most successful bike brand in 2023, with its sponsorship of four WorldTour teams – including the force in women’s cycling SD Worx – paying off as it clocked up three more stage wins than Canyon, which had a strong Classics year thanks to Mathieu van der Poel.

There were a few big changes coming into the season, including Groupama-FDJ and Lapierre splitting for the first time ever and the new Decathlon-AG2R setup bringing Decathlon’s Van Rysel brand to the top level with a huge amount of success so far.

With the 2024 Tour de France approaching, including the inevitable influx of new bikes that’ll be launched in the days before the race starts, let’s take stock of what the current situation is and what’s due an update.

Related Posts

Inside the weird and wonderful world of pro cycling merchandise

All the 2024 WorldTour kits ranked from worst to first

All the cycling tech leaked by the pros in 2024 including the new Canyon Aeroad, Pinarello Dogma F and Trek Madone/Emonda

Who actually are the Tour de France team sponsors 2024?

Men’s and women’s WorldTour team bikes 2024

Alpecin-Deceuninck and Fenix-Deceuninck

With Mathieu van der Poel and Jasper Philipsen, Canyon has more than justified its sponsorship of Alpecin-Deceuninck and its women’s team Fenix-Deceuninck had a strong Tour de France Femmes in their first WorldTour season.

There’s a new Aeroad due imminently.

  • Bike: Canyon Aeroad, Ultimate
  • Bottle cage: Elite
  • Clothing: Kalas
  • Computer: Wahoo
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Helmets: Abus
  • Shoes: Shimano
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Vittoria
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace

Arkéa-B&B Hotels

They’ve switched Samsic for B&B Hotels, but Arkéa generally has the same-setup as 2023 with Bianchi bikes. The most notable change is switching from Shimano to Vision wheels.

  • Bike: Bianchi Specialissima, Oltre RC
  • Clothing: Ekoï
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebars/stem: Vision
  • Helmets: Ekoï
  • Saddle: Selle Italia 
  • Sunglasses: Ekoï
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa Pro
  • Wheels: Vision

Astana Qazaqstan

They’ve got Mark Cavendish and they’ve got one of the prettiest bikes in the peloton, it could be a big July for Wilier if Cav breaks the record. The brand looks to be set to bring out a new road bike (spotted being ridden by Groupama-FDJ riders) and has a very fancy new time-trial bike.

  • Bike: Wilier Filante SLR, Zero SLR, Turbine 
  • Bottle cage: Tacx 
  • Bottom bracket: Ceramic Speed BB86 
  • Clothing: Biemme
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo 
  • Helmets: Limar
  • Pedals: Look Kéo Blade carbon 
  • Pulley: Ceramic Speed OSPW 
  • Saddle: Prologo Scratch 2 
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa Pro
  • Wheels: Vision

Bahrain Victorious 

Bahrain Victorious’s Tour de France special edition white kit from last year has become permanent for 2024, sadly Fred Wright won’t be defending his national road race title so take one last look at his special bike.

  • Bike: Merida Reacto Disc Team, Scultura Disc Team, Time Warp TT 
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Alé
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo
  • Handlebars/stem: FSA 
  • Helmet: Rudy Project
  • Power meter: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Saddle: Prologo Scratch M5, Scratch M5 CPC, Dimension, Dimension Tri 
  • Seatpost: FSA
  • Sunglasses: Rudy Project
  • Tyres: Continental
  • Wheels: Vision Metron SL 45 Disc and 60 Disc

Bora-Hansgrohe

Bora-Hansgrohe have made with switch from Shimano to SRAM for 2024, which may have something to do with new signing Primož Roglič, they’ve also abandoned their lovely Le Col kit for old flame Sportful, which definitely has something to do with Peter Sagan’s retirement.

SRAM recently released a new version of its top tier Red AXS groupset, which its sponsored teams will be using for the foreseeable future.

  • Bike: Specialized S-Works Tarmac SL8, Roubaix, Shiv TT Disc 
  • Bottle cage: Specialized 
  • Clothing: Sportful
  • Computer: Hammerhead Karoo 2 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red AXS
  • Handlebar tape: Supacaz
  • Handlebars/stem: Roval Rapide
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Power meter: Quarq
  • Saddle: S-Works Power with Mirror 
  • Shoes: Specialized
  • Sunglasses: Koo
  • Tyres: Specialized Turbo
  • Wheels: Roval CLX Rapide

Canyon-SRAM Racing

The Canyon-SRAM aesthetics are 10/10 still, as they’ll be on the new Aeroad with new SRAM Red. Shiny.

  • Bike: Canyon Aeroad CFR, Canyon Ultimate, Canyon Speedmax TT
  • Clothing: Canyon
  • Computer: Hammerhead Karoo 2
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS 
  • Helmet: Giro
  • Pedals: Time
  • Power meter: Quarq 
  • Saddle: Ergon 
  • Shoes: Canyon?
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Schwalbe 
  • Wheels: Zipp

Cofidis

Cofidis are riding these utterly lovely Look bikes in 2024.

  • Bike: Look
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Mobel
  • Computer: Wahoo 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 with Look cranks
  • Helmet: Ekoï
  • Pedals: Look 
  • Power meter: SRM
  • Saddle: Selle Italia 
  • Sunglasses: Ekoï
  • Tyres: Michelin 
  • Wheels: Corima MCC DX, WS Black DX, WS TT DX

Decathlon-AG2R

Swapping BMC for Decathlon’s Van Rysel branded bike, Decathlon-AG2R went through some big changes during the off-season. They even ditched Campagnolo for Shimano, leaving the Italians without a WorldTour representative.

It’s all paid off though as 2024 has been a hugely successful year for the team so far, but will Van Rysel bring something new to its home race? There haven’t been any hints of it and it’s not due given how new its all-rounder RCR bike is, but it wouldn’t be a surprise.

  • Bike: Van Rysel RCR, XCR 
  • Clothing: Rosti
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebars/stem: Deda
  • Handlebar tape: Fizik
  • Helmets: Van Rysel CPR, FCR, XCR
  • Pedals: Look Kéo Blade Ceramic, Ceramic Ti 
  • Saddle: Fizik
  • Sunglasses: Van Rysel
  • Tyres: Continental Grand-Prix 5000 S TR 
  • Wheels: Swiss Side Hadron 2 Ultimate 380/500/625

DSM-Firmenich-Post NL

Colour and branding are the only new things for DSM etc this year.

  • Bike: Scott Addict RC, Foil RC, Plasma 
  • Bottles and bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Nalini
  • Computer: Wahoo 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Helmet: Scott Cadence, Centric plus
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Power meter: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Saddle: Syncros Tofino, Savona and Belcarra
  • Shoes: Shimano
  • Sunglasses: Driive
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa Pro, Corsa Control, Speed
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace C36, C50, C60

EF Education-EasyPost

They’re undoubtedly the coolest team in the peloton, and officially have the best kit. The new paintjob isn’t bad either.

  • Bike: Cannondale SuperSix Evo, System Six, SuperSlice
  • Bottle cages: Elite
  • Bottles: Cannondale
  • Bottom bracket: Shimano BSA threaded
  • Clothing: Rapha
  • Computer: Wahoo  
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 with FSA crankset
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo Onetouch 2 and Onetouch 2 Gel
  • Handlebars/stem: Cannondale/Momo Design
  • Helmet: Poc
  • Pedals: Wahoo Speedplay
  • Power meter: NG and NGeco PowerBox
  • Saddle: Prologo Dimension
  • Sunglasses: Poc
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa
  • Wheels: Vision Metron SL  

FDJ-Suez

While the men’s Groupama-FDJ team have moved off Lapierre, FDJ-Suez have stuck by the French brand for 2024.

  • Bike: Lapierre Aircode DRS, Xelius SL, Aérostorm DRS
  • Bottles and bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Gobik
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo
  • Helmet: Lazer
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Saddle: Prologo
  • Shoes: Shimano
  • Suglasses: Shimano
  • Tyres: Continental
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace

Groupama-FDJ

It’s more obvious than ever that the men’s and women’s FDJ teams are separate entities, the men’s Groupama-FDJ team have split with Lapierre for the first time ever, bringing on these lovely Wilier bikes. Riders have been spotted on a new Wilier road bike, and Stefan Küng has helped the brand develop a fancy new TT bike.

  • Bike: Wilier Filante, Zero, Supersonica
  • Bottle cage: Elite Leggero Carbon
  • Clothing: Alé
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo
  • Helmet: Julbo
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Saddle: Prologo Scratch
  • Sunglasses: Julbo
  • Tyres: Continental Competition Pro LTD
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace

Human Powered Health

Human Powered Health have made a big switch from Felt to Factor bikes for 2024, and doesn’t it look glorious.

  • Bike: Factor Ostro VAM, O2 VAM 
  • Bottle cage: Arundel 
  • Clothing: Pactimo
  • Computer: Wahoo 
  • Groupset: SRAM Force eTap AXS 
  • Handlebar tape: Supacaz 
  • Handlebars/stem: Black Inc
  • Helmet: Smith
  • Pedals: Wahoo Speedplay 
  • Power meter: Quarq
  • Saddle: Prologo 
  • Tyres: Goodyear 
  • Wheels: Black Inc

Ineos Grenadiers 

Ineos Grenadiers switched their kit from Bioracer to Gobik this year, and they’ve been spotted on a new Pinarello Dogma F too.

  • Bike: Pinarello Dogma F, Bolide F TT 
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Gobik
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebar tape: Most Ultragrip 
  • Handlebars/stem
  • Helmet: Kask Elemento, Utopia
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Saddle: Prologo
  • Sunglasses: SunGod
  • Tyres: Continental Grand-Prix 5000 S TR
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace

Intermarché-Circus-Wanty

While their kit isn’t to everyone’s taste, Intermarché’s Cube bikes and Newmen wheels look sensational.

  • Bike: Cube Litening Aero C:68X, Litening Air C:68X
  • Bottle cage: Elite Vico Carbon
  • Clothing: Verge
  • Computer: Bryton Rider S800
  • Crankset: Rotor
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo 
  • Helmet: Uvex
  • Pedals: Look Kéo Blade Carbon Ceramic Ti 
  • Power meter: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Saddle: Prologo 
  • Shoes: Gaerne
  • Sunglasses: Uvex
  • Tyres: Continental GP5000 S TR/TT TR
  • Wheels: Newmen Advanced SL R.42/R.65 Vonoa

Israel-Premier Tech

Israel-Premier Tech are Factor’s premier men’s team, and they were spotted on the new Ostro VAM all the way back at the Tour Down Under, so there shouldn’t be anything new for the Tour.

  • Bike: Factor Ostro VAM, O2 VAM
  • Bottles: Elite
  • Clothing: Ekoï
  • Components: FSA
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Helmet: Ekoï
  • Saddle: Selle Italia
  • Sunglasses: Ekoï
  • Turbo trainer: Elite
  • Tyres: Continental
  • Wheels: Black Inc

Jayco-AlUla and Liv-AlUla-Jayco

Mostly colour changes for the GreenEdge teams with these contenders for the best paintjobs of the season. Liv Racing Xstra merging with the women’s team has added some colour and boy has it paid off.

  • Bike: Giant TCR, Propel, Trinity Advanced Pro TT, Liv Langma Advanced Disc SL 
  • Bottle cage: Giant 
  • Clothing: Alé
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Helmet: Giant
  • Pedals: Shimano
  • Saddle: Giant, Cadex Boost 
  • Sunlasses: Scicon
  • Tyres: Cadex 
  • Wheels: Cadex 36, 42, 65, Aero Disc, 4-Spoke 

Laboral Kutxa-Fundación Euskadi

Basque Continental team Laboral Kutxa-Fundación Euskadi will be making their first Tour de France Femmes appearance this year.

  • Bikes: Orbea Orca
  • Bottle cages: Elite
  • Clothing: Exteondo
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Helmet: Abus
  • Shoes: DMT
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Vittoria
  • Wheels: Oquo

Lidl-Trek

The least quiet launch of recent years came in the shape of the new Trek Madone SLR in 2022 with a crazy looking hole in the seatpost, there looks. to be another one on the way but it’s not yet clear whether it’s a Madone or an Émonda.

  • Bike: Trek Émonda, Madone, Domane, Speed Concept 
  • Clothing: Santini
  • Computer: Wahoo 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS 
  • Helmet: Trek
  • Pedals: Time
  • Power meter: Quarq 
  • Saddle: Bontrager Verse Pro
  • Shoes: Bontrager
  • Sunglasses: 100% 
  • Tyres: Pirelli P Zero Race
  • Wheels: Bontrager Aeolus RSL

Lotto-Dstny

Lotto-Dstny controversially switched from Ridley to Orbea this year.

  • Bikes: Orbea Orca
  • Bottles and cages: Tacx
  • Components: FSA
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Handlebar tape: Lizard Skins
  • Helmet: Ekoï
  • Saddle: Selle Italia
  • Socks: DeFeet
  • Sunglasses: Ekoï
  • Turbo trainer: Tacx
  • Tyres: Vittoria
  • Wheels: Oquo/Zipp

Movistar

Movistar’s men’s and women’s teams are the same unit, so use the same stuff. That means Canyon, SRAM and Zipp lead the way. They’re already on the unreleased Aeroad.

  • Bike: Canyon Aeroad CFR, Canyon Ultimate, Speedmax CFR TT
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Gobik
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS 
  • Handlebar tape: Lizard Skins 
  • Helmet: Abus
  • Pedals: Time
  • Power meter: Quarq 
  • Saddle: Fizik Antares Versus Evo 00 
  • Shoes: Fizik
  • Sunglasses: 100%
  • Tyres: Continental 
  • Wheels: Zipp

Roland

After Israel-Premier Tech pulled out of the team it’s all change for Swiss team Roland, they’ve switched Factor for Pinarello, with FSA and Vision parts, and are wearing Q36.5 kit and Limar helmets. 

  • Bike: Pinarello Dogma F
  • Bottle cage and bottles: Tacx 
  • Clothing: Q36.5
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace, FSA crankset
  • Handlebars/stem: Roval Rapide
  • Helmet: Limar
  • Sunglasses: Limar
  • Tyres: Pirelli 
  • Wheels: Vision

SD Worx-Protime

It won’t come as a surprise that SD Worx’s suppliers remain unchanged for 2024.

  • Bike: Specialized S-Works Tarmac SL8, Shiv TT 
  • Bottle cage: Tacx 
  • Clothing: Specialized
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS 
  • Handlebars/stem: Roval Rapide
  • Helmet: Specialized
  • Pedals: Time 
  • Power meter: Quarq 
  • Saddle: Specialized S-Works Power 
  • Shoes: Specialized
  • Sunglasses: Roka
  • Tyres: Specialized Turbo 
  • Wheels: Roval Alpinist CLX (Zipp for TT bike)

Soudal-QuickStep and AG Insurance-Soudal

One of the most predictable in the peloton. It’s always going to be Specialized and Shimano here, barring something extraordinary, and Soudal-QuickStep and women’s team AG Insurance-Soudal have the same kit now.

  • Bike: Specialized S-Works Tarmac SL8, Roubaix SL8
  • Bottle cage: Tacx 
  • Bottom bracket: CeramicSpeed 
  • Clothing: Castelli
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebar tape: Supacaz 
  • Helmet: Specialized
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Power meter: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Saddle: Specialized S-Works Power with Mirror 
  • Shoes: Specialized
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Specialized Turbo Cotton 
  • Wheels: Roval Rapide CLX, Alpinist CLX, CLX 50, CLX 64, 321 Discs

St. Michel-Mavic-Auber93

French Continental team St. Michel-Mavic-Auber93 have a lovely colour scheme, and last year’s time-trial even led to a biscuit-themed disc wheel.

  • Bike: Cannondale
  • Clothing: Poli
  • Components: FSA
  • Groupset: Shimano
  • Helmet: Ekoï
  • Pedals: Look
  • Saddle: Prologo
  • Sunglasses: Ekoï
  • Tyres: Michelin
  • Wheels: Mavic

Tashkent City Women

This team is a bit of a mystery, as you can tell from the selection of completely different helmets, but here are the consistencies…

  • Clothing: Alka

That’s it.

TotalEnergies

After the departure of Peter Sagan, TotalEnergies switched bike sponsor from Specialized to Enve in the brand’s first road pro bike sponsorship.

  • Bike: Enve, Specialized Shiv for time-trials
  • Clothing: Sportful
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Helmet: HJC
  • Saddle: Sella Italia
  • Sunglasses: 100%
  • Wheels: Enve

UAE Team ADQ

UAE Team ADQ’s set-up is unchanged for 2024, and why would you want to change it?

  • Bike: Colnago V4Rs
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Pissei
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo 
  • Helmet: Met
  • Saddle: Prologo 
  • Sunglasses: Scicon
  • Tyres: Continental
  • Wheels: Enve

UAE Team Emirates

UAE Team Emirates have the same sponsors as UAE Team ADQ with a slightly different paintjob, and expect those Enve wheels to be extra loud this year.

  • Bike: Colnago V4Rs, TT01 
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Pissei
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape:  Prologo 
  • Handlebars/stem: Enve
  • Helmet: Met
  • Pedals: Look Kéo Blade Carbon Ti 
  • Saddle: Prologo 
  • Sunglasses: Scicon
  • Tyres: Continental
  • Wheels: Enve

Uno-X

The Norwegian team are unchanged for 2024, and with some big names added to their men’s team. They’ve been spotted on a new aero bike in the run up to the Tour.’ve

  • Bike: Dare MA-AFO, VSRu, TSRf (TT)
  • Bottles and bottle cages: Elite
  • Clothing: Bioracer
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Helmet: Sweet Protection
  • OSPW: CeramicSpeed
  • Saddle: Prologo
  • Shoes: Shimano
  • Sunglasses: Sweet Protection
  • Tyres: Schwalbe Pro One
  • Wheels: DT Swiss
  • Extras: WattShop aero accessories, CeramicSpeed OSPW

Visma-Lease a Bike

Despite the name change, Visma-Lease a Bike are largely the same, they’ve even kept the yellow. The most notable change is probably switching from Lazer to Giro helmets. And it’s weird that they’re Garmin sponsored but use Wahoo Speedplay pedals.

  • Bike: Cervélo R5, S5, Caledonia, P5 
  • Bottle cage: Tacx 
  • Clothing: Agu
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS  
  • Handlebar tape: Fizik 
  • Helmet: Giro
  • Pedals: Wahoo Speedplay
  • Power meter: Quarq
  • Saddle: Fizik 
  • Shoes: Nimbl
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa Pro
  • Wheels: Reserve

But what do the names mean? Check out our full breakdown of who the Tour de France team sponsors actually are
